How can I print a DataFrame in Python on a single line instead of the automatic multi-line formatting? Currently, when I use the following code:

```python
import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_csv('pima-data.csv')
print(df.head(2))
```

The output is formatted across multiple lines like this:

```python
   num_preg  glucose_conc  diastolic_bp  thickness  insulin   bmi  diab_pred  \
0         6           148            72         35        0  33.6      0.627   
1         1            85            66         29        0  26.6      0.351   

   age    skin diabetes  
0   50  1.3790     True  
1   31  1.1426    False 
```

However, I would like it to be printed on a single line like this:

```python
   num_preg  glucose_conc  diastolic_bp  thickness  insulin       bmi      diab_pred     age       skin      diabetes  
0         6           148            72         35        0      33.6          0.627      50     1.3790          True  
1         1            85            66         29        0      26.6          0.351      31     1.1426         False 
```

To print a DataFrame on a single line, you can convert it to a string and replace newline characters with spaces. Here's how you can achieve this:

```python
import pandas as pd

# Read the CSV file
df = pd.read_csv('pima-data.csv')

# Get the first two rows of the DataFrame
df_head = df.head(2)

# Convert the DataFrame to a string without the default formatting
df_str = df_head.to_string(index=False)

# Replace newline characters with spaces
single_line_output = df_str.replace('\n', ' ')

# Print the single line output
print(single_line_output)
```

This code utilizes the `to_string()` method of the DataFrame, which allows you to control the formatting. By setting `index=False`, it avoids printing the index column, and by replacing newline characters with spaces, the output is formatted on a single line.
